medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressive bilateral leg weakness, bilateral leg pain, and difficulty walking.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced a 4-week history of progressive bilateral leg weakness and pain, without exacerbating or ameliorating factors. The weakness was symmetric and did not fluctuate throughout the day. She also reported depression, anxiety, memory problems, and intermittent headaches, which began several months earlier. Her previously active lifestyle had deteriorated to being homebound due to leg weakness.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of breast cancer (diagnosed 20 years earlier; treated with lumpectomy and radiation), gastroesophageal reflux disease, hypertension, and irritable bowel syndrome. Smoked one pack of cigarettes daily for 45 years.
medical_history.family_history: Father had chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, mother had neuromyelitis optica, one sibling had scleroderma, and another sibling had head and neck cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Patient had a significant smoking history of one pack of cigarettes daily for 45 years.
